sub_title: Third Year Honours Student studying Marketing Management at Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen. Currently participating in a "Rethinking Sustainable Societies" minor program at the University of Amsterdam.
summary:
An ambitious third-year Marketing Management and Honours student with an interest in sales, advertising, and project management. I'm thrilled to announce that I have started a minor program at the University of Amsterdam, diving into the fascinating realm of "Rethinking Sustainable Societies". Completed an internship at Mondelez, where I expanded my knowledge of what skills a good manager requires to lead projects and successfully run a company. Strong ability to work effectively both in a team and independently. Able to remain dedicated and motivated while completing tasks. Keen to rise to the occasion and obtain an internship as an undergraduate work placement which will provide me with opportunities for further development and progression. 

I look forward to hearing from you and don’t hesitate to contact me in case of any questions.

projects.title: Digital Marketing Audit for Nespresso
projects.description: My group and I created a digital audit on Nespresso which involves a thorough analysis on the company's online presence to assess its strengths and weaknesses. This includes a review of their website design and functionality, social media presence, search engine optimization, digital advertising, and e-commerce capabilities. The goal of the digital audit is to identify opportunities for improvement and provide recommendations for maximizing the effectiveness of Nespresso's digital marketing efforts and overall online presence. This process will involve gathering data, conducting competitor analysis, and evaluating user experience to ensure that Nespresso is effectively reaching its target audience and providing a seamless online experience.

projects.title: Research proposal for Faun & Luna on entering the Dutch market
projects.description: My group and I created a research proposal for the start-up company Faun & Luna to provide them with insightful advice on successfully entering the Dutch market.  Using the design thinking process we were able to come up with innovative ways to introduce and integrate their small business into the Netherlands. This involved talking to our target audience and finding out their needs and desires. Based on their feedback, we were able to develop creative solutions that Faun and Luna could integrate into their marketing strategy.  We turned our ideas into real and practical solutions to make sure they would be as successful as possible to help Faun and Luna enter the Dutch market.

contributors.headline: Third Year Honours Student studying Marketing Management at Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen. Currently participating in a "Rethinking Sustainable Societies" minor program at the University of Amsterdam.

projects.title: Research report for Share on entering the Dutch market
projects.description: Share is a startup company originating in Berlin that embodies social consumerism by contributing a portion of its profits to many NGOs and represents the concept of social consumption. Share is present in Germany, Austria, and the Czech Republic, but they are looking to expand further into the Dutch market. My group and I conducted extensive research and insightful advice on the Netherlands, Dutch consumer habits, and how Share could best enter the market.

contributors.headline: Third Year Honours Student studying Marketing Management at Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen. Currently participating in a "Rethinking Sustainable Societies" minor program at the University of Amsterdam.

projects.title: Creation of our start-up company: Coco Nucifera
projects.description: Coco Nucifera is a start-up company with the vision to provide our mature audience with an organic, handmade, all-purpose balm that will allow them to feel youthful and glowing. After conducting a variety of research, we discovered that especially the older generation struggle to keep up an effective skincare routine as the types of products offered on the market are often overwhelming, complicated to understand, and filled with ingredients that are harmful to sensitive skin. Our mission was to create a handmade balm filled with chemical-free and gentle ingredients which naturally provide the skin, hair, and body with anti-aging benefits and rejuvenating factors. The all-purpose balm takes away the stress of having to deal with dozens of different tubes and pots filled with unreliable skincare products. The all-purpose balm can reliably be used anytime, anywhere. We pride ourselves in fulfilling the needs of our customers, whether it's providing them with glowing skin, voluminous hair, or soft hands. We set ourselves apart from the competition by adding a personalized touch to each of our products, as each is filled by hand, and each purchase comes with a personalized inspirational note. Our customers know that they are in the best hands, with Coco Nucifera.

projects.title: Omnichannel content strategy for HEMA
projects.description: Our idea is to turn HEMAs cake decorating service into a competition. To enter the cake competition, a picture of the decorated cake has to be posted on a social media platform, using the “#HEMACAKECOMPTITION2023” tag. We believe that posting on the right platform, at the right time, and with the right message will create massive awareness amongst our target audience. We believe the way to make customers loyal is to encourage them to repeat purchases. We plan on doing this by handing out gift cards to those who win the competition. With these gift cards, the winners can buy HEMAs products where they can discover good quality at affordable prices and make a repeat purchase.

contributors.headline: Third Year Honours Student studying Marketing Management at Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen. Currently participating in a "Rethinking Sustainable Societies" minor program at the University of Amsterdam.

projects.title: Marketing Advice for HEMA
projects.description: For our project, we wanted to create a product that sets HEMA apart from others as being the store that cares, not only about its customers but also about the future of our planet and the wellbeing of our future generation. We want HEMA to become the store that has it all, for every wish and demand HEMA has a high-quality yet affordable solution. We want people to say that “all you need is HEMA”, to fulfill your every need. With this in mind, we created the “all-you-need” boxes. The “all-you-need” box saves customers from stressing over how to decorate for a holiday, birthday, or dinner party, by supplying the customer with all essential party decor items. When someone is lacking the time to shop for a first baby necessity product or the first day of school items, the “all-you-need” box saves you from accidentally forgetting to buy something essential, as all the essentials have been carefully selected by the HEMA team. The “all-you-need” box allows for a convenient, effective, and sustainable shopping experience which leaves customers feeling relieved and relaxed for the upcoming event. The boxes come in 3 sizes. The products and packaging are all 100% recyclable or biodegradable. Each box contains all essential HEMA products which one may need alongside one limited edition item which makes the box more desirable. Finally, buying the entire box saves the customers money than if they had to buy each product individually.

profile_positions.description: I spent one week accompanying Ben Wicks, who is head of Confectionery Marketing for Mondelez Europe. I took part in taste testing for Toblerone, joined meetings on new product development for Milka as well as advertising design sessions for Cadbury.
profile_positions.title: Internship with the General Manager and Global Marketing Director of Cadbury

volunteer_experiences.description: I joined a non-profit organization based in Switzerland called MUNTERWEGS. I spent a year with a young girl called Kamalee and her family who had just moved to Switzerland from Pakistan. I taught her how to read and write German, we explored the swiss countryside and nearby towns showing her swiss culture.

My classmates and I stayed with a Ghanaian family at the kokrobite Chiltern center. We built an aquaponics system to allow the village to be self-sufficient as they can now fish and grow vegetables. Furthermore, we build a literacy center using water bottles to build the foundation. I got to experience Ghanaian culture, history, and attractions.
